content_old: 2 and he hath no inheritance in the midst of his brethren; Jehovah Himself is his inheritance, as He hath spoken to him.

content: 3 ‘And this is the priest’s right from the people, from those sacrificing a sacrifice, whether ox or sheep, he hath even given to the priest the leg, and the two cheeks, and the stomach;
content_old: 3 ‘And this is the priest’s right from the people, from those sacrificing a sacrifice, whether ox or sheep, he hath even given to the priest the leg, and the two cheeks, and the stomach;

content: 4 the first of thy corn, of thy new wine, and of thine oil, and the first of the fleece of thy flock, thou dost give to him;
content_old: 4 the first of thy corn, of thy new wine, and of thine oil, and the first of the fleece of thy flock, thou dost give to him;

content: 5 for on him hath Jehovah thy God fixed, out of all thy tribes, to stand to serve in the name of Jehovah, He and his sons continually.
content_old: 5 for on him hath Jehovah thy God fixed, out of all thy tribes, to stand to serve in the name of Jehovah, He and his sons continually.

content: 6 ‘And when the Levite cometh from one of thy cities out of all Israel, where he hath sojourned, and hath come with all the desire of his soul unto the place which Jehovah doth choose,
content_old: 6 ‘And when the Levite cometh from one of thy cities out of all Israel, where he hath sojourned, and hath come with all the desire of his soul unto the place which Jehovah doth choose,

content: 7 then he hath ministered in the name of Jehovah his God, like all his brethren, the Levites, who are standing there before Jehovah,
content_old: 7 then he hath ministered in the name of Jehovah his God, like all his brethren, the Levites, who are standing there before Jehovah,

content: 8 portion as portion they do eat, apart from his sold things, with the fathers.
content_old: 8 portion as portion they do eat, apart from his sold things, with the fathers.

content: 9 ‘When thou art coming in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, thou dost not learn to do according to the abominations of those nations:
content_old: 9 ‘When thou art coming in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, thou dost not learn to do according to the abominations of those nations:

content: 10 there is not found in thee one causing his son and his daughter to pass over into fire, a user of divinations, an observer of clouds, and an enchanter, and a sorcerer,
content_old: 10 there is not found in thee one causing his son and his daughter to pass over into fire, a user of divinations, an observer of clouds, and an enchanter, and a sorcerer,

content: 11 and a charmer, and one asking at a familiar spirit, and a wizard, and one seeking unto the dead.
content_old: 11 and a charmer, and one asking at a familiar spirit, and a wizard, and one seeking unto the dead.

content: 12 ‘For the abomination of Jehovah is every one doing these, and because of these abominations is Jehovah thy God dispossessing them from thy presence.
content_old: 12 ‘For the abomination of Jehovah is every one doing these, and because of these abominations is Jehovah thy God dispossessing them from thy presence.

content: 13 Perfect thou art with Jehovah thy God,
content_old: 13 Perfect thou art with Jehovah thy God,

content: 14 for these nations whom thou art possessing, unto observers of clouds, and unto diviners, do hearken; and thou—not so hath Jehovah thy God suffered thee.
content_old: 14 for these nations whom thou art possessing, unto observers of clouds, and unto diviners, do hearken; and thou—not so hath Jehovah thy God suffered thee.

content: 15 ‘A prophet out of thy midst, out of thy brethren, like to me, doth Jehovah thy God raise up to thee—unto him ye hearken;
content_old: 15 ‘A prophet out of thy midst, out of thy brethren, like to me, doth Jehovah thy God raise up to thee—unto him ye hearken;

content: 16 according to all that thou didst ask from Jehovah thy God, in Horeb, in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not add to hear the voice of Jehovah my God, and this great fire let me not see any more, and I die not;
content_old: 16 according to all that thou didst ask from Jehovah thy God, in Horeb, in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not add to hear the voice of Jehovah my God, and this great fire let me not see any more, and I die not;

content: 17 and Jehovah saith unto me, They have done well that they have spoken;
content_old: 17 and Jehovah saith unto me, They have done well that they have spoken;

content: 18 a prophet I raise up to them, out of the midst of their brethren, like to thee; and I have given my words in his mouth, and he hath spoken unto them all that which I command him;
content_old: 18 a prophet I raise up to them, out of the midst of their brethren, like to thee; and I have given my words in his mouth, and he hath spoken unto them all that which I command him;

content: 19 and it hath been—the man who doth not hearken unto My words which he doth speak in My name, I require it of him.
content_old: 19 and it hath been—the man who doth not hearken unto My words which he doth speak in My name, I require it of him.

content: 20 ‘Only, the prophet who presumeth to speak a word in My name—that which I have not commanded him to speak—and who speaketh in the name of other gods—even that prophet hath died.
content_old: 20 ‘Only, the prophet who presumeth to speak a word in My name—that which I have not commanded him to speak—and who speaketh in the name of other gods—even that prophet hath died.

content: 21 ‘And when thou sayest in thy heart, How do we know the word which Jehovah hath not spoken?—
content_old: 21 ‘And when thou sayest in thy heart, How do we know the word which Jehovah hath not spoken?—

content: 1 ‘When Jehovah thy God doth cut off the nations, whose land Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, and thou hast succeeded them, and dwelt in their cities, and in their houses,
content_old: 1 ‘When Jehovah thy God doth cut off the nations, whose land Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, and thou hast succeeded them, and dwelt in their cities, and in their houses,

content: 2 three cities thou dost separate for thee in the midst of thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee to possess it.
content_old: 2 three cities thou dost separate for thee in the midst of thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee to possess it.

content: 3 Thou dost prepare for thee the way, and hast divided into three parts the border of thy land which Jehovah thy God doth cause thee to inherit, and it hath been for the fleeing thither of every man-slayer.
content_old: 3 Thou dost prepare for thee the way, and hast divided into three parts the border of thy land which Jehovah thy God doth cause thee to inherit, and it hath been for the fleeing thither of every man-slayer.

content: 4 ‘And this is the matter of the man-slayer who fleeth thither, and hath lived: He who smiteth his neighbour unknowingly, and is not hating him heretofore,
content_old: 4 ‘And this is the matter of the man-slayer who fleeth thither, and hath lived: He who smiteth his neighbour unknowingly, and is not hating him heretofore,

content: 5 even he who cometh in with his neighbour into a forest to hew wood, and his hand hath driven with an axe to cut the tree, and the iron hath slipped from the wood, and hath met his neighbour, and he hath died—he doth flee unto one of these cities, and hath lived,
content_old: 5 even he who cometh in with his neighbour into a forest to hew wood, and his hand hath driven with an axe to cut the tree, and the iron hath slipped from the wood, and hath met his neighbour, and he hath died—he doth flee unto one of these cities, and hath lived,

content: 6 lest the redeemer of blood pursue after the man-slayer when his heart is hot, and hath overtaken him (because the way is great), and hath smitten him—the life, and he hath no sentence of death, for he is not hating him heretofore;
content_old: 6 lest the redeemer of blood pursue after the man-slayer when his heart is hot, and hath overtaken him (because the way is great), and hath smitten him—the life, and he hath no sentence of death, for he is not hating him heretofore;

content: 7 therefore I am commanding thee, saying, Three cities thou dost separate to thee.
content_old: 7 therefore I am commanding thee, saying, Three cities thou dost separate to thee.

content: 8 ‘And if Jehovah thy God doth enlarge thy border, as He hath sworn to thy fathers, and hath given to thee all the land which He hath spoken to give to thy fathers—
content_old: 8 ‘And if Jehovah thy God doth enlarge thy border, as He hath sworn to thy fathers, and hath given to thee all the land which He hath spoken to give to thy fathers—

content: 9 when thou keepest all this command to do it, which I am commanding thee to-day, to love Jehovah thy God, and to walk in His ways all the days—then thou hast added to thee yet three cities to these three;
content_old: 9 when thou keepest all this command to do it, which I am commanding thee to-day, to love Jehovah thy God, and to walk in His ways all the days—then thou hast added to thee yet three cities to these three;

content: 10 and innocent blood is not shed in the midst of thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee—an inheritance, and there hath been upon thee blood.
content_old: 10 and innocent blood is not shed in the midst of thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee—an inheritance, and there hath been upon thee blood.

content: 11 ‘And when a man is hating his neighbour, and hath lain in wait for him, and risen against him, and smitten him—the life, and he hath died, and he hath fled unto one of these cities,
content_old: 11 ‘And when a man is hating his neighbour, and hath lain in wait for him, and risen against him, and smitten him—the life, and he hath died, and he hath fled unto one of these cities,

content: 12 then the elders of his city have sent and taken him from thence, and given him into the hand of the redeemer of blood, and he hath died;
content_old: 12 then the elders of his city have sent and taken him from thence, and given him into the hand of the redeemer of blood, and he hath died;

content: 13 thine eye hath no pity on him, and thou hast put away the innocent blood from Israel, and it is well with thee.
content_old: 13 thine eye hath no pity on him, and thou hast put away the innocent blood from Israel, and it is well with thee.

content: 14 ‘Thou dost not remove a border of thy neighbour, which they of former times have made, in thine inheritance, which thou dost inherit in the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee to possess it.
content_old: 14 ‘Thou dost not remove a border of thy neighbour, which they of former times have made, in thine inheritance, which thou dost inherit in the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee to possess it.

content: 15 ‘One witness doth not rise against a man for any iniquity, and for any sin, in any sin which he sinneth; by the mouth of two witnesses, or by the mouth of three witnesses, is a thing established.
content_old: 15 ‘One witness doth not rise against a man for any iniquity, and for any sin, in any sin which he sinneth; by the mouth of two witnesses, or by the mouth of three witnesses, is a thing established.

content: 16 ‘When a violent witness doth rise against a man, to testify against him apostasy,
content_old: 16 ‘When a violent witness doth rise against a man, to testify against him apostasy,

content: 17 then have both the men who have the strife stood before Jehovah, before the priests and the judges who are in those days,
content_old: 17 then have both the men who have the strife stood before Jehovah, before the priests and the judges who are in those days,

content: 18 and the judges have searched diligently, and lo, the witness is a false witness, a falsehood he hath testified against his brother:
content_old: 18 and the judges have searched diligently, and lo, the witness is a false witness, a falsehood he hath testified against his brother:

content: 19 ‘Then ye have done to him as he devised to do to his brother, and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst,
content_old: 19 ‘Then ye have done to him as he devised to do to his brother, and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst,

content: 20 and those who are left do hear and fear, and add not to do any more according to this evil thing in thy midst;
content_old: 20 and those who are left do hear and fear, and add not to do any more according to this evil thing in thy midst;

content: 1 ‘When thou goest out to battle against thine enemy, and hast seen horse and chariot—a people more numerous than thou—thou art not afraid of them, for Jehovah thy God is with thee, who is bringing thee up out of the land of Egypt;
content_old: 1 ‘When thou goest out to battle against thine enemy, and hast seen horse and chariot—a people more numerous than thou—thou art not afraid of them, for Jehovah thy God is with thee, who is bringing thee up out of the land of Egypt;

content: 2 and it hath been, in your drawing near unto the battle, that the priest hath come nigh, and spoken unto the people,
content_old: 2 and it hath been, in your drawing near unto the battle, that the priest hath come nigh, and spoken unto the people,

content: 3 and said unto them, Hear, Israel, ye are drawing near to-day to battle against your enemies, let not your hearts be tender, fear not, nor make haste, nor be terrified at their presence,
content_old: 3 and said unto them, Hear, Israel, ye are drawing near to-day to battle against your enemies, let not your hearts be tender, fear not, nor make haste, nor be terrified at their presence,

content: 4 for Jehovah your God is He who is going with you, to fight for you with your enemies—to save you.
content_old: 4 for Jehovah your God is He who is going with you, to fight for you with your enemies—to save you.

content: 5 ‘And the authorities have spoken unto the people, saying, Who is the man that hath built a new house, and hath not dedicated it?—let him go and turn back to his house, lest he die in battle, and another man dedicate it.
content_old: 5 ‘And the authorities have spoken unto the people, saying, Who is the man that hath built a new house, and hath not dedicated it?—let him go and turn back to his house, lest he die in battle, and another man dedicate it.

content: 6 ‘And who is the man that hath planted a vineyard, and hath not made it common?—let him go and turn back to his house, lest he die in battle, and another man make it common.
content_old: 6 ‘And who is the man that hath planted a vineyard, and hath not made it common?—let him go and turn back to his house, lest he die in battle, and another man make it common.

content: 7 ‘And who is the man that hath betrothed a woman, and hath not taken her?—let him go and turn back to his house, lest he die in battle, and another man take her.
content_old: 7 ‘And who is the man that hath betrothed a woman, and hath not taken her?—let him go and turn back to his house, lest he die in battle, and another man take her.

content: 8 ‘And the authorities have added to speak unto the people, and said, Who is the man that is afraid and tender of heart?—let him go and turn back to his house, and the heart of his brethren doth not melt like his heart;
content_old: 8 ‘And the authorities have added to speak unto the people, and said, Who is the man that is afraid and tender of heart?—let him go and turn back to his house, and the heart of his brethren doth not melt like his heart;

content: 9 and it hath come to pass as the authorities finish to speak unto the people, that they have appointed princes of the hosts at the head of the people.
content_old: 9 and it hath come to pass as the authorities finish to speak unto the people, that they have appointed princes of the hosts at the head of the people.

content: 10 ‘When thou drawest near unto a city to fight against it, then thou hast called unto it for Peace,
content_old: 10 ‘When thou drawest near unto a city to fight against it, then thou hast called unto it for Peace,

content: 11 and it hath been, if Peace it answer thee, and hath opened to thee, then it hath come to pass—all the people who are found in it are to thee for tributaries, and have served thee.
content_old: 11 and it hath been, if Peace it answer thee, and hath opened to thee, then it hath come to pass—all the people who are found in it are to thee for tributaries, and have served thee.

content: 12 ‘And if it doth not make peace with thee, and hath made with thee war, then thou hast laid siege against it,
content_old: 12 ‘And if it doth not make peace with thee, and hath made with thee war, then thou hast laid siege against it,

content: 13 and Jehovah thy God hath given it into thy hand, and thou hast smitten every male of it by the mouth of the sword.
content_old: 13 and Jehovah thy God hath given it into thy hand, and thou hast smitten every male of it by the mouth of the sword.

content: 14 Only, the women, and the infants, and the cattle, and all that is in the city, all its spoil, thou dost seize for thyself, and thou hast eaten the spoil of thine enemies which Jehovah thy God hath given to thee.
content_old: 14 Only, the women, and the infants, and the cattle, and all that is in the city, all its spoil, thou dost seize for thyself, and thou hast eaten the spoil of thine enemies which Jehovah thy God hath given to thee.

content: 15 So thou dost do to all the cities which are very far off from thee, which are not of the cities of these nations.
content_old: 15 So thou dost do to all the cities which are very far off from thee, which are not of the cities of these nations.

content: 16 ‘Only, of the cities of these peoples which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee for an inheritance, thou dost not keep alive any breathing;
content_old: 16 ‘Only, of the cities of these peoples which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee for an inheritance, thou dost not keep alive any breathing;

content: 17 for thou dost certainly devote the Hittite, and the Amorite, the Canaanite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, as Jehovah thy God hath commanded thee,
content_old: 17 for thou dost certainly devote the Hittite, and the Amorite, the Canaanite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, as Jehovah thy God hath commanded thee,

content: 18 so that they teach you not to do according to all their abominations which they have done to their gods, and ye have sinned against Jehovah your God.
content_old: 18 so that they teach you not to do according to all their abominations which they have done to their gods, and ye have sinned against Jehovah your God.

content: 19 ��When thou layest siege unto a city many days, to fight against it, to capture it, thou dost not destroy its trees to force an axe against them, for of them thou dost eat, and them thou dost not cut down—for man’s is the tree of the field—to go in at thy presence in the siege.
content_old: 19 ��When thou layest siege unto a city many days, to fight against it, to capture it, thou dost not destroy its trees to force an axe against them, for of them thou dost eat, and them thou dost not cut down—for man’s is the tree of the field—to go in at thy presence in the siege.

content: 1 ‘When one is found slain on the ground which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee to possess it—fallen in a field—it is not known who hath smitten him,
content_old: 1 ‘When one is found slain on the ground which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee to possess it—fallen in a field—it is not known who hath smitten him,

content: 2 then have thine elders and thy judges gone out and measured unto the cities which are round about the slain one,
content_old: 2 then have thine elders and thy judges gone out and measured unto the cities which are round about the slain one,

content: 3 and it hath been, the city which is near unto the slain one, even the elders of that city have taken a heifer of the herd, which hath not been wrought with, which hath not drawn in the yoke,
content_old: 3 and it hath been, the city which is near unto the slain one, even the elders of that city have taken a heifer of the herd, which hath not been wrought with, which hath not drawn in the yoke,

content: 4 and the elders of that city have brought down the heifer unto a hard valley, which is not tilled nor sown, and have beheaded there the heifer in the valley.
content_old: 4 and the elders of that city have brought down the heifer unto a hard valley, which is not tilled nor sown, and have beheaded there the heifer in the valley.

content: 5 ‘And the priests, sons of Levi, have come nigh—for on them hath Jehovah thy God fixed to serve Him, and to bless in the name of Jehovah, and by their mouth is every strife, and every stroke—
content_old: 5 ‘And the priests, sons of Levi, have come nigh—for on them hath Jehovah thy God fixed to serve Him, and to bless in the name of Jehovah, and by their mouth is every strife, and every stroke—

content: 6 and all the elders of that city, who are near unto the slain one, do wash their hands over the heifer which is beheaded in the valley,
content_old: 6 and all the elders of that city, who are near unto the slain one, do wash their hands over the heifer which is beheaded in the valley,

content: 7 and they have answered and said, Our hands have not shed this blood, and our eyes have not seen—
content_old: 7 and they have answered and said, Our hands have not shed this blood, and our eyes have not seen—

content: 8 receive atonement for Thy people Israel, whom Thou hast ransomed, O Jehovah, and suffer not innocent blood in the midst of Thy people Israel; and the blood hath been pardoned to them,
content_old: 8 receive atonement for Thy people Israel, whom Thou hast ransomed, O Jehovah, and suffer not innocent blood in the midst of Thy people Israel; and the blood hath been pardoned to them,

content: 9 and thou dost put away the innocent blood out of thy midst, for thou dost that which is right in the eyes of Jehovah.
content_old: 9 and thou dost put away the innocent blood out of thy midst, for thou dost that which is right in the eyes of Jehovah.

content: 10 ‘When thou goest out to battle against thine enemies, and Jehovah thy God hath given them into thy hand, and thou hast taken captive its captivity,
content_old: 10 ‘When thou goest out to battle against thine enemies, and Jehovah thy God hath given them into thy hand, and thou hast taken captive its captivity,

content: 11 and hast seen in the captivity a woman of fair form, and hast delighted in her, and hast taken to thee for a wife,
content_old: 11 and hast seen in the captivity a woman of fair form, and hast delighted in her, and hast taken to thee for a wife,

content: 12 then thou hast brought her in unto the midst of thy household, and she hath shaved her head, and prepared her nails,
content_old: 12 then thou hast brought her in unto the midst of thy household, and she hath shaved her head, and prepared her nails,

content: 13 and turned aside the raiment of her captivity from off her, and hath dwelt in thy house, and bewailed her father and her mother a month of days, and afterwards thou dost go in unto her and hast married her, and she hath been to thee for a wife:
content_old: 13 and turned aside the raiment of her captivity from off her, and hath dwelt in thy house, and bewailed her father and her mother a month of days, and afterwards thou dost go in unto her and hast married her, and she hath been to thee for a wife:

content: 14 ‘And it hath been—if thou hast not delighted in her, that thou hast sent her away at her desire, and thou dost not at all sell her for money; thou dost not tyrannize over her, because that thou hast humbled her.
content_old: 14 ‘And it hath been—if thou hast not delighted in her, that thou hast sent her away at her desire, and thou dost not at all sell her for money; thou dost not tyrannize over her, because that thou hast humbled her.

content: 15 ‘When a man hath two wives, the one loved and the other hated, and they have borne to him sons (the loved one and the hated one), and the first-born son hath been to the hated one;
content_old: 15 ‘When a man hath two wives, the one loved and the other hated, and they have borne to him sons (the loved one and the hated one), and the first-born son hath been to the hated one;

content: 16 then it hath been, in the day of his causing his sons to inherit that which he hath, he is not able to declare first-born the son of the loved one, in the face of the son of the hated one—the first-born.
content_old: 16 then it hath been, in the day of his causing his sons to inherit that which he hath, he is not able to declare first-born the son of the loved one, in the face of the son of the hated one—the first-born.

content: 17 But the first-born, son of the hated one, he doth acknowledge, to give to him a double portion of all that is found with him, for he is the beginning of his strength; to him is the right of the first-born.
content_old: 17 But the first-born, son of the hated one, he doth acknowledge, to give to him a double portion of all that is found with him, for he is the beginning of his strength; to him is the right of the first-born.

content: 18 ‘When a man hath a son apostatizing and rebellious—he is not hearkening to the voice of his father, and to the voice of his mother, and they have chastised him, and he doth not hearken unto them—
content_old: 18 ‘When a man hath a son apostatizing and rebellious—he is not hearkening to the voice of his father, and to the voice of his mother, and they have chastised him, and he doth not hearken unto them—

content: 19 then laid hold on him have his father and his mother, and they have brought him out unto the elders of his city, and unto the gate of his place,
content_old: 19 then laid hold on him have his father and his mother, and they have brought him out unto the elders of his city, and unto the gate of his place,

content: 20 and have said unto the elders of his city, Our son—this one—is apostatizing and rebellious; he is not hearkening to our voice—a glutton and drunkard;
content_old: 20 and have said unto the elders of his city, Our son—this one—is apostatizing and rebellious; he is not hearkening to our voice—a glutton and drunkard;

content: 21 and all the men of his city have stoned him with stones, and he hath died, and thou hast put away the evil out of thy midst, and all Israel do hear and fear.
content_old: 21 and all the men of his city have stoned him with stones, and he hath died, and thou hast put away the evil out of thy midst, and all Israel do hear and fear.

content: 22 ‘And when there is in a man a sin—a cause of death, and he hath been put to death, and thou hast hanged him on a tree,
content_old: 22 ‘And when there is in a man a sin—a cause of death, and he hath been put to death, and thou hast hanged him on a tree,

content: 1 ‘Thou dost not see the ox of thy brother or his sheep driven away, and hast hidden thyself from them, thou dost certainly turn them back to thy brother;
content_old: 1 ‘Thou dost not see the ox of thy brother or his sheep driven away, and hast hidden thyself from them, thou dost certainly turn them back to thy brother;

content: 2 and if thy brother is not near unto thee, and thou hast not known him, then thou hast removed it unto the midst of thy house, and it hath been with thee till thy brother seek it, and thou hast given it back to him;
content_old: 2 and if thy brother is not near unto thee, and thou hast not known him, then thou hast removed it unto the midst of thy house, and it hath been with thee till thy brother seek it, and thou hast given it back to him;

content: 3 and so thou dost to his ass, and so thou dost to his garment, and so thou dost to any lost thing of thy brother’s, which is lost by him, and thou hast found it; thou art not able to hide thyself.
content_old: 3 and so thou dost to his ass, and so thou dost to his garment, and so thou dost to any lost thing of thy brother’s, which is lost by him, and thou hast found it; thou art not able to hide thyself.

content: 4 ‘Thou dost not see the ass of thy brother, or his ox, falling in the way, and hast hid thyself from them; thou dost certainly raise them up with him.
content_old: 4 ‘Thou dost not see the ass of thy brother, or his ox, falling in the way, and hast hid thyself from them; thou dost certainly raise them up with him.

content: 5 ‘The habiliments of a man are not on a woman, nor doth a man put on the garment of a woman, for the abomination of Jehovah thy God is any one doing these.
content_old: 5 ‘The habiliments of a man are not on a woman, nor doth a man put on the garment of a woman, for the abomination of Jehovah thy God is any one doing these.

content: 6 ‘When a bird’s nest cometh before thee in the way, in any tree, or on the earth, brood or eggs, and the mother sitting on the brood or on the eggs, thou dost not take the mother with the young ones;
content_old: 6 ‘When a bird’s nest cometh before thee in the way, in any tree, or on the earth, brood or eggs, and the mother sitting on the brood or on the eggs, thou dost not take the mother with the young ones;

content: 7 thou dost certainly send away the mother, and the young ones dost take to thyself, so that it is well with thee, and thou hast prolonged days.
content_old: 7 thou dost certainly send away the mother, and the young ones dost take to thyself, so that it is well with thee, and thou hast prolonged days.

content: 8 ‘When thou buildest a new house, then thou hast made a parapet to thy roof, and thou dost not put blood on thy house when one falleth from it.
content_old: 8 ‘When thou buildest a new house, then thou hast made a parapet to thy roof, and thou dost not put blood on thy house when one falleth from it.

content: 9 ‘Thou dost not sow thy vineyard with divers things, lest the fulness of the seed which thou dost sow, and the increase of the vineyard, be separated.
content_old: 9 ‘Thou dost not sow thy vineyard with divers things, lest the fulness of the seed which thou dost sow, and the increase of the vineyard, be separated.

content: 10 ‘Thou dost not plow with an ox and with an ass together.
content_old: 10 ‘Thou dost not plow with an ox and with an ass together.

content: 11 ‘Thou dost not put on a mixed cloth, wool and linen together.
content_old: 11 ‘Thou dost not put on a mixed cloth, wool and linen together.

content: 12 ‘Fringes thou dost make to thee on the four skirts of thy covering with which thou dost cover thyself.
content_old: 12 ‘Fringes thou dost make to thee on the four skirts of thy covering with which thou dost cover thyself.

content: 13 ‘When a man taketh a wife, and hath gone in unto her, and hated her,
content_old: 13 ‘When a man taketh a wife, and hath gone in unto her, and hated her,

content: 14 and laid against her actions of words, and brought out against her an evil name, and said, This woman I have taken, and I draw near unto her, and I have not found in her tokens of virginity:
content_old: 14 and laid against her actions of words, and brought out against her an evil name, and said, This woman I have taken, and I draw near unto her, and I have not found in her tokens of virginity:

content: 15 ‘Then hath the father of the damsel—and her mother—taken and brought out the tokens of virginity of the damsel unto the elders of the city in the gate,
content_old: 15 ‘Then hath the father of the damsel—and her mother—taken and brought out the tokens of virginity of the damsel unto the elders of the city in the gate,

content: 16 and the father of the damsel hath said unto the elders, My daughter I have given to this man for a wife, and he doth hate her;
content_old: 16 and the father of the damsel hath said unto the elders, My daughter I have given to this man for a wife, and he doth hate her;

content: 17 and lo, he hath laid actions of words, saying, I have not found to thy daughter tokens of virginity—and these are the tokens of the virginity of my daughter! and they have spread out the garment before the elders of the city.
content_old: 17 and lo, he hath laid actions of words, saying, I have not found to thy daughter tokens of virginity—and these are the tokens of the virginity of my daughter! and they have spread out the garment before the elders of the city.

content: 18 ‘And the elders of that city have taken the man, and chastise him,
content_old: 18 ‘And the elders of that city have taken the man, and chastise him,

content: 19 and fined him a hundred silverlings, and given to the father of the damsel, because he hath brought out an evil name on a virgin of Israel, and she is to him for a wife, he is not able to send her away all his days.
content_old: 19 and fined him a hundred silverlings, and given to the father of the damsel, because he hath brought out an evil name on a virgin of Israel, and she is to him for a wife, he is not able to send her away all his days.

content: 20 ‘And if this thing hath been truth—tokens of virginity have not been found for the damsel—
content_old: 20 ‘And if this thing hath been truth—tokens of virginity have not been found for the damsel—

content: 21 then they have brought out the damsel unto the opening of her father’s house, and stoned her have the men of her city with stones, and she hath died, for she hath done folly in Israel, to go a-whoring in her father’s house; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.
content_old: 21 then they have brought out the damsel unto the opening of her father’s house, and stoned her have the men of her city with stones, and she hath died, for she hath done folly in Israel, to go a-whoring in her father’s house; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.

content: 22 ‘When a man is found lying with a woman, married to a husband, then they have died even both of them, the man who is lying with the woman, also the woman; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of Israel.
content_old: 22 ‘When a man is found lying with a woman, married to a husband, then they have died even both of them, the man who is lying with the woman, also the woman; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of Israel.

content: 23 ‘When there is a damsel, a virgin, betrothed to a man, and a man hath found her in a city, and lain with her;
content_old: 23 ‘When there is a damsel, a virgin, betrothed to a man, and a man hath found her in a city, and lain with her;

content: 24 then ye have brought them both out unto the gate of that city, and stoned them with stones, and they have died:—the damsel, because that she hath not cried, being in a city; and the man, because that he hath humbled his neighbour’s wife; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.
content_old: 24 then ye have brought them both out unto the gate of that city, and stoned them with stones, and they have died:—the damsel, because that she hath not cried, being in a city; and the man, because that he hath humbled his neighbour’s wife; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.

content: 25 ‘And if in a field the man find the damsel who is betrothed, and the man hath laid hold on her, and lain with her, then hath the man who hath lain with her died alone;
content_old: 25 ‘And if in a field the man find the damsel who is betrothed, and the man hath laid hold on her, and lain with her, then hath the man who hath lain with her died alone;

content: 26 and to the damsel thou dost not do anything, the damsel hath no deadly sin; for as a man riseth against his neighbour and hath murdered him—the life, so is this thing;
content_old: 26 and to the damsel thou dost not do anything, the damsel hath no deadly sin; for as a man riseth against his neighbour and hath murdered him—the life, so is this thing;

content: 27 for in a field he found her, she hath cried—the damsel who is betrothed—and she hath no saviour.
content_old: 27 for in a field he found her, she hath cried—the damsel who is betrothed—and she hath no saviour.

content: 28 ‘When a man findeth a damsel, a virgin who is not betrothed, and hath caught her, and lain with her, and they have been found,
content_old: 28 ‘When a man findeth a damsel, a virgin who is not betrothed, and hath caught her, and lain with her, and they have been found,

content: 29 then hath the man who is lying with her given to the father of the damsel fifty silverlings, and to him she is for a wife; because that he hath humbled her, he is not able to send her away all his days.
content_old: 29 then hath the man who is lying with her given to the father of the damsel fifty silverlings, and to him she is for a wife; because that he hath humbled her, he is not able to send her away all his days.

content: 1 ‘One wounded, bruised, or cut in the member doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah;
content_old: 1 ‘One wounded, bruised, or cut in the member doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah;

content: 2 a bastard doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of him doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
content_old: 2 a bastard doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of him doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah.

content: 3 ‘An Ammonite and a Moabite doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of them doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah—to the age;
content_old: 3 ‘An Ammonite and a Moabite doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of them doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah—to the age;

content: 4 because that they have not come before you with bread and with water in the way, in your coming out from Egypt, and because he hath hired against thee Balaam son of Beor, of Pethor of Aram-Naharaim, to revile thee;
content_old: 4 because that they have not come before you with bread and with water in the way, in your coming out from Egypt, and because he hath hired against thee Balaam son of Beor, of Pethor of Aram-Naharaim, to revile thee;

content: 5 and Jehovah thy God hath not been willing to hearken unto Balaam, and Jehovah thy God doth turn for thee the reviling to a blessing, because Jehovah thy God hath loved thee;
content_old: 5 and Jehovah thy God hath not been willing to hearken unto Balaam, and Jehovah thy God doth turn for thee the reviling to a blessing, because Jehovah thy God hath loved thee;

content: 6 thou dost not seek their peace and their good all thy days—to the age.
content_old: 6 thou dost not seek their peace and their good all thy days—to the age.

content: 7 ‘Thou dost not abominate an Edomite, for thy brother he is; thou dost not abominate an Egyptian, for a sojourner thou hast been in his land;
content_old: 7 ‘Thou dost not abominate an Edomite, for thy brother he is; thou dost not abominate an Egyptian, for a sojourner thou hast been in his land;

content: 8 sons who are begotten of them, a third generation of them, doth enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
content_old: 8 sons who are begotten of them, a third generation of them, doth enter into the assembly of Jehovah.

content: 9 ‘When a camp goeth out against thine enemies, then thou hast kept from every evil thing.
content_old: 9 ‘When a camp goeth out against thine enemies, then thou hast kept from every evil thing.

content: 10 ‘When there is in thee a man who is not clean, from an accident at night—then he hath gone out unto the outside of the camp—he doth not come in unto the midst of the camp—
content_old: 10 ‘When there is in thee a man who is not clean, from an accident at night—then he hath gone out unto the outside of the camp—he doth not come in unto the midst of the camp—

content: 11 and it hath been, at the turning of the evening, he doth bathe with water, and at the going in of the sun he doth come in unto the midst of the camp.
content_old: 11 and it hath been, at the turning of the evening, he doth bathe with water, and at the going in of the sun he doth come in unto the midst of the camp.

content: 12 ‘And a station thou hast at the outside of the camp, and thou hast gone out thither without,
content_old: 12 ‘And a station thou hast at the outside of the camp, and thou hast gone out thither without,

content: 13 and a nail thou hast on thy staff, and it hath been, in thy sitting without, that thou hast digged with it, and turned back, and covered thy filth;
content_old: 13 and a nail thou hast on thy staff, and it hath been, in thy sitting without, that thou hast digged with it, and turned back, and covered thy filth;

content: 14 for Jehovah thy God is walking up and down in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee, and to give thine enemies before thee, and thy camp hath been holy, and He doth not see in thee the nakedness of anything, and hath turned back from after thee.
content_old: 14 for Jehovah thy God is walking up and down in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee, and to give thine enemies before thee, and thy camp hath been holy, and He doth not see in thee the nakedness of anything, and hath turned back from after thee.

content: 15 ‘Thou dost not shut up a servant unto his lord, who is delivered unto thee from his lord;
content_old: 15 ‘Thou dost not shut up a servant unto his lord, who is delivered unto thee from his lord;

content: 16 with thee he doth dwell, in thy midst, in the place which he chooseth within one of thy gates, where it is pleasing to him; thou dost not oppress him.
content_old: 16 with thee he doth dwell, in thy midst, in the place which he chooseth within one of thy gates, where it is pleasing to him; thou dost not oppress him.

content: 17 ‘There is not a whore among the daughters of Israel, nor is there a whoremonger among the sons of Israel;
content_old: 17 ‘There is not a whore among the daughters of Israel, nor is there a whoremonger among the sons of Israel;

content: 18 thou dost not bring a gift of a whore, or a price of a dog, into the house of Jehovah thy God, for any vow; for the abomination of Jehovah thy God are even both of them.
content_old: 18 thou dost not bring a gift of a whore, or a price of a dog, into the house of Jehovah thy God, for any vow; for the abomination of Jehovah thy God are even both of them.

content: 19 ‘Thou dost not lend in usury to thy brother; usury of money, usury of food, usury of anything which is lent on usury.
content_old: 19 ‘Thou dost not lend in usury to thy brother; usury of money, usury of food, usury of anything which is lent on usury.

content: 20 To a stranger thou mayest lend in usury, and to thy brother thou dost not lend in usury, so that Jehovah thy God doth bless thee in every putting forth of thy hand on the land whither thou goest in to possess it.
content_old: 20 To a stranger thou mayest lend in usury, and to thy brother thou dost not lend in usury, so that Jehovah thy God doth bless thee in every putting forth of thy hand on the land whither thou goest in to possess it.

content: 21 ‘When thou vowest a vow to Jehovah thy God, thou dost not delay to complete it; for Jehovah thy God doth certainly require it from thee, and it hath been in thee—sin.
content_old: 21 ‘When thou vowest a vow to Jehovah thy God, thou dost not delay to complete it; for Jehovah thy God doth certainly require it from thee, and it hath been in thee—sin.

content: 22 ‘And when thou forbearest to vow, it is not in thee a sin.
content_old: 22 ‘And when thou forbearest to vow, it is not in thee a sin.

content: 23 The produce of thy lips thou dost keep, and hast done it, as thou hast vowed to Jehovah thy God; a free-will-offering, which thou hast spoken with thy mouth.
content_old: 23 The produce of thy lips thou dost keep, and hast done it, as thou hast vowed to Jehovah thy God; a free-will-offering, which thou hast spoken with thy mouth.

content: 24 ‘When thou comest in unto the vineyard of thy neighbour, then thou hast eaten grapes, according to thy desire, thy sufficiency; but into thy vessel thou dost not put any.
content_old: 24 ‘When thou comest in unto the vineyard of thy neighbour, then thou hast eaten grapes, according to thy desire, thy sufficiency; but into thy vessel thou dost not put any.

content: 1 ‘When a man doth take a wife, and hath married her, and it hath been, if she doth not find grace in his eyes (for he hath found in her nakedness of anything), and he hath written for her a writing of divorce, and given it into her hand, and sent her out of his house,
content_old: 1 ‘When a man doth take a wife, and hath married her, and it hath been, if she doth not find grace in his eyes (for he hath found in her nakedness of anything), and he hath written for her a writing of divorce, and given it into her hand, and sent her out of his house,

content: 2 and she hath gone out of his house, and hath gone and been another man’s,
content_old: 2 and she hath gone out of his house, and hath gone and been another man’s,

content: 3 and the latter man hath hated her, and written for her a writing of divorce, and given it into her hand, and sent her out of his house, or when the latter man dieth, who hath taken her to himself for a wife:
content_old: 3 and the latter man hath hated her, and written for her a writing of divorce, and given it into her hand, and sent her out of his house, or when the latter man dieth, who hath taken her to himself for a wife:

content: 4 ‘Her former husband who sent her away is not able to turn back to take her to be to him for a wife, after that she hath become defiled; for an abomination it is before Jehovah, and thou dost not cause the land to sin which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee—an inheritance.
content_old: 4 ‘Her former husband who sent her away is not able to turn back to take her to be to him for a wife, after that she hath become defiled; for an abomination it is before Jehovah, and thou dost not cause the land to sin which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee—an inheritance.

content: 5 ‘When a man taketh a new wife, he doth not go out into the host, and one doth not pass over unto him for anything; free he is at his own house one year, and hath rejoiced his wife whom he hath taken.
content_old: 5 ‘When a man taketh a new wife, he doth not go out into the host, and one doth not pass over unto him for anything; free he is at his own house one year, and hath rejoiced his wife whom he hath taken.

content: 6 ‘None doth take in pledge millstones, and rider, for life it is he is taking in pledge.
content_old: 6 ‘None doth take in pledge millstones, and rider, for life it is he is taking in pledge.

content: 7 ‘When a man is found stealing a person, of his brethren, of the sons of Israel, and hath tyrannized over him, and sold him, then hath that thief died, and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.
content_old: 7 ‘When a man is found stealing a person, of his brethren, of the sons of Israel, and hath tyrannized over him, and sold him, then hath that thief died, and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.

content: 8 ‘Take heed, in the plague of leprosy, to watch greatly, and to do according to all that the priests, the Levites, teach you; as I have commanded them ye observe to do;
content_old: 8 ‘Take heed, in the plague of leprosy, to watch greatly, and to do according to all that the priests, the Levites, teach you; as I have commanded them ye observe to do;

content: 9 remember that which Jehovah thy God hath done to Miriam in the way, in your coming out of Egypt.
content_old: 9 remember that which Jehovah thy God hath done to Miriam in the way, in your coming out of Egypt.

content: 10 ‘When thou liftest up on thy brother a debt of anything, thou dost not go in unto his house to obtain his pledge;
content_old: 10 ‘When thou liftest up on thy brother a debt of anything, thou dost not go in unto his house to obtain his pledge;

content: 11 at the outside thou dost stand, and the man on whom thou art lifting it up is bringing out unto thee the pledge at the outside.
content_old: 11 at the outside thou dost stand, and the man on whom thou art lifting it up is bringing out unto thee the pledge at the outside.

content: 12 ‘And if he is a poor man, thou dost not lie down with his pledge;
content_old: 12 ‘And if he is a poor man, thou dost not lie down with his pledge;

content: 13 thou dost certainly give back to him the pledge at the going in of the sun, and he hath lain down in his own raiment, and hath blessed thee; and to thee it is righteousness before Jehovah thy God.
content_old: 13 thou dost certainly give back to him the pledge at the going in of the sun, and he hath lain down in his own raiment, and hath blessed thee; and to thee it is righteousness before Jehovah thy God.

content: 14 ‘Thou dost not oppress a hireling, poor and needy, of thy brethren or of thy sojourner who is in thy land within thy gates;
content_old: 14 ‘Thou dost not oppress a hireling, poor and needy, of thy brethren or of thy sojourner who is in thy land within thy gates;

content: 15 in his day thou dost give his hire, and the sun doth not go in upon it, for he is poor, and unto it he is lifting up his soul, and he doth not cry against thee unto Jehovah, and it hath been in thee—sin.
content_old: 15 in his day thou dost give his hire, and the sun doth not go in upon it, for he is poor, and unto it he is lifting up his soul, and he doth not cry against thee unto Jehovah, and it hath been in thee—sin.

content: 16 ‘Fathers are not put to death for sons, and sons are not put to death for fathers—each for his own sin, they are put to death.
content_old: 16 ‘Fathers are not put to death for sons, and sons are not put to death for fathers—each for his own sin, they are put to death.

content: 17 ‘Thou dost not turn aside the judgment of a fatherless sojourner, nor take in pledge the garment of a widow;
content_old: 17 ‘Thou dost not turn aside the judgment of a fatherless sojourner, nor take in pledge the garment of a widow;

content: 18 and thou hast remembered that a servant thou hast been in Egypt, and Jehovah thy God doth ransom thee from thence; therefore I am commanding thee to do this thing.
content_old: 18 and thou hast remembered that a servant thou hast been in Egypt, and Jehovah thy God doth ransom thee from thence; therefore I am commanding thee to do this thing.

content: 19 ‘When thou reapest thy harvest in thy field, and hast forgotten a sheaf in a field, thou dost not turn back to take it; to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, it is; so that Jehovah thy God doth bless thee in all the work of thy hands.
content_old: 19 ‘When thou reapest thy harvest in thy field, and hast forgotten a sheaf in a field, thou dost not turn back to take it; to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, it is; so that Jehovah thy God doth bless thee in all the work of thy hands.

content: 20 ‘When thou beatest thine olive, thou dost not examine the branch behind thee; to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, it is.
content_old: 20 ‘When thou beatest thine olive, thou dost not examine the branch behind thee; to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, it is.

content: 21 ‘When thou cuttest thy vineyard, thou dost not glean behind thee; to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, it is;
content_old: 21 ‘When thou cuttest thy vineyard, thou dost not glean behind thee; to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, it is;

content: 1 ‘When there is a strife between men, and they have come nigh unto the judgment, and they have judged, and declared righteous the righteous, and declared wrong the wrong-doer,
content_old: 1 ‘When there is a strife between men, and they have come nigh unto the judgment, and they have judged, and declared righteous the righteous, and declared wrong the wrong-doer,

content: 2 then it hath come to pass, if the wrong-doer is to be smitten, that the judge hath caused him to fall down, and one hath smitten him in his presence, according to the sufficiency of his wrong-doing, by number;
content_old: 2 then it hath come to pass, if the wrong-doer is to be smitten, that the judge hath caused him to fall down, and one hath smitten him in his presence, according to the sufficiency of his wrong-doing, by number;

content: 3 forty times he doth smite him—he is not adding, lest, he is adding to smite him above these—many stripes, and thy brother is lightly esteemed in thine eyes.
content_old: 3 forty times he doth smite him—he is not adding, lest, he is adding to smite him above these—many stripes, and thy brother is lightly esteemed in thine eyes.

content: 4 ‘Thou dost not muzzle an ox in its threshing.
content_old: 4 ‘Thou dost not muzzle an ox in its threshing.

content: 5 ‘When brethren dwell together, and one of them hath died, and hath no son, the wife of the dead is not without to a strange man; her husband’s brother doth go in unto her, and hath taken her to him for a wife, and doth perform the duty of her husband’s brother;
content_old: 5 ‘When brethren dwell together, and one of them hath died, and hath no son, the wife of the dead is not without to a strange man; her husband’s brother doth go in unto her, and hath taken her to him for a wife, and doth perform the duty of her husband’s brother;

content: 6 and it hath been, the first-born which she beareth doth rise for the name of his dead brother, and his name is not wiped away out of Israel.
content_old: 6 and it hath been, the first-born which she beareth doth rise for the name of his dead brother, and his name is not wiped away out of Israel.

content: 7 ‘And if the man doth not delight to take his brother’s wife, then hath his brother’s wife gone up to the gate, unto the elders, and said, My husband’s brother is refusing to raise up to his brother a name in Israel; he hath not been willing to perform the duty of my husband’s brother;
content_old: 7 ‘And if the man doth not delight to take his brother’s wife, then hath his brother’s wife gone up to the gate, unto the elders, and said, My husband’s brother is refusing to raise up to his brother a name in Israel; he hath not been willing to perform the duty of my husband’s brother;

content: 8 and the elders of his city have called for him, and spoken unto him, and he hath stood and said, I have no desire to take her;
content_old: 8 and the elders of his city have called for him, and spoken unto him, and he hath stood and said, I have no desire to take her;

content: 9 ‘Then hath his brother’s wife drawn nigh unto him, before the eyes of the elders, and drawn his shoe from off his foot, and spat in his face, and answered and said, Thus it is done to the man who doth not build up the house of his brother;
content_old: 9 ‘Then hath his brother’s wife drawn nigh unto him, before the eyes of the elders, and drawn his shoe from off his foot, and spat in his face, and answered and said, Thus it is done to the man who doth not build up the house of his brother;

content: 10 and his name hath been called in Israel—The house of him whose shoe is drawn off.
content_old: 10 and his name hath been called in Israel—The house of him whose shoe is drawn off.

content: 11 ‘When men strive together, one with another, and the wife of the one hath drawn near to deliver her husband out of the hand of his smiter, and hath put forth her hand, and laid hold on his secrets,
content_old: 11 ‘When men strive together, one with another, and the wife of the one hath drawn near to deliver her husband out of the hand of his smiter, and hath put forth her hand, and laid hold on his secrets,

content: 12 then thou hast cut off her hand, thine eye doth not spare.
content_old: 12 then thou hast cut off her hand, thine eye doth not spare.

content: 13 ‘Thou hast not in thy bag a stone and a stone, a great and a small.
content_old: 13 ‘Thou hast not in thy bag a stone and a stone, a great and a small.

content: 14 Thou hast not in thy house an ephah and an ephah, a great and a small.
content_old: 14 Thou hast not in thy house an ephah and an ephah, a great and a small.

content: 15 Thou hast a stone complete and just, thou hast an ephah complete and just, so that they prolong thy days on the ground which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee;
content_old: 15 Thou hast a stone complete and just, thou hast an ephah complete and just, so that they prolong thy days on the ground which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee;

content: 16 for the abomination of Jehovah thy God is any one doing these things, any one doing iniquity.
content_old: 16 for the abomination of Jehovah thy God is any one doing these things, any one doing iniquity.

content: 17 ‘Remember that which Amalek hath done to thee in the way, in your going out from Egypt,
content_old: 17 ‘Remember that which Amalek hath done to thee in the way, in your going out from Egypt,

content: 18 that he hath met thee in the way, and smiteth in all those feeble behind thee (and thou wearied and fatigued), and is not fearing God.
content_old: 18 that he hath met thee in the way, and smiteth in all those feeble behind thee (and thou wearied and fatigued), and is not fearing God.

content: 1 ‘And it hath been, when thou comest in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee—an inheritance, and thou hast possessed it, and dwelt in it,
content_old: 1 ‘And it hath been, when thou comest in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee—an inheritance, and thou hast possessed it, and dwelt in it,

content: 2 that thou hast taken of the first of all the fruits of the ground which thou dost bring in out of thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, and hast put it in a basket, and gone unto the place which Jehovah thy God doth choose to cause His name to tabernacle there.
content_old: 2 that thou hast taken of the first of all the fruits of the ground which thou dost bring in out of thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, and hast put it in a basket, and gone unto the place which Jehovah thy God doth choose to cause His name to tabernacle there.

content: 3 ‘And thou hast come in unto the priest who is in those days, and hast said unto him, I have declared to-day to Jehovah thy God, that I have come in unto the land which Jehovah hath sworn to our fathers to give to us;
content_old: 3 ‘And thou hast come in unto the priest who is in those days, and hast said unto him, I have declared to-day to Jehovah thy God, that I have come in unto the land which Jehovah hath sworn to our fathers to give to us;

content: 4 and the priest hath taken the basket out of thy hand, and placed it before the altar of Jehovah thy God.
content_old: 4 and the priest hath taken the basket out of thy hand, and placed it before the altar of Jehovah thy God.

content: 5 ‘And thou hast answered and said before Jehovah thy God, A perishing Aramaean is my father! and he goeth down to Egypt, and sojourneth there with few men, and becometh there a nation, great, mighty, and numerous;
content_old: 5 ‘And thou hast answered and said before Jehovah thy God, A perishing Aramaean is my father! and he goeth down to Egypt, and sojourneth there with few men, and becometh there a nation, great, mighty, and numerous;

content: 6 and the Egyptians do us evil, and afflict us, and put on us hard service;
content_old: 6 and the Egyptians do us evil, and afflict us, and put on us hard service;

content: 7 and we cry unto Jehovah, God of our fathers, and Jehovah heareth our voice, and seeth our affliction, and our labour, and our oppression;
content_old: 7 and we cry unto Jehovah, God of our fathers, and Jehovah heareth our voice, and seeth our affliction, and our labour, and our oppression;

content: 8 and Jehovah bringeth us out from Egypt, by a strong hand, and by a stretched-out arm, and by great fear, and by signs, and by wonders,
content_old: 8 and Jehovah bringeth us out from Egypt, by a strong hand, and by a stretched-out arm, and by great fear, and by signs, and by wonders,

content: 9 and he bringeth us in unto this place, and giveth to us this land—a land flowing with milk and honey.
content_old: 9 and he bringeth us in unto this place, and giveth to us this land—a land flowing with milk and honey.

content: 10 ‘And now, lo, I have brought in the first of the fruits of the ground which thou hast given to me, O Jehovah;—and thou hast placed it before Jehovah thy God, and bowed thyself before Jehovah thy God,
content_old: 10 ‘And now, lo, I have brought in the first of the fruits of the ground which thou hast given to me, O Jehovah;—and thou hast placed it before Jehovah thy God, and bowed thyself before Jehovah thy God,

content: 11 and rejoiced in all the good which Jehovah thy God hath given to thee, and to thy house, thou, and the Levite, and the sojourner who is in thy midst.
content_old: 11 and rejoiced in all the good which Jehovah thy God hath given to thee, and to thy house, thou, and the Levite, and the sojourner who is in thy midst.

content: 12 ‘When thou dost complete to tithe all the tithe of thine increase in the third year, the year of the tithe, then thou hast given to the Levite, to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, and they have eaten within thy gates, and been satisfied,
content_old: 12 ‘When thou dost complete to tithe all the tithe of thine increase in the third year, the year of the tithe, then thou hast given to the Levite, to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, and they have eaten within thy gates, and been satisfied,

content: 13 and thou hast said before Jehovah thy God, I have put away the separated thing out of the house, and also have given it to the Levite, and to the sojourner, and to the orphan, and to the widow, according to all Thy command which Thou hast commanded me; I have not passed over from Thy commands, nor have I forgotten.
content_old: 13 and thou hast said before Jehovah thy God, I have put away the separated thing out of the house, and also have given it to the Levite, and to the sojourner, and to the orphan, and to the widow, according to all Thy command which Thou hast commanded me; I have not passed over from Thy commands, nor have I forgotten.

content: 14 I have not eaten in mine affliction of it, nor have I put away of it for uncleanness, nor have I given of it for the dead; I have hearkened to the voice of Jehovah my God; I have done according to all that Thou hast commanded me;
content_old: 14 I have not eaten in mine affliction of it, nor have I put away of it for uncleanness, nor have I given of it for the dead; I have hearkened to the voice of Jehovah my God; I have done according to all that Thou hast commanded me;

content: 15 look from Thy holy habitation, from the heavens, and bless Thy people Israel, and the ground which Thou hast given to us, as Thou hast sworn to our fathers—a land flowing with milk and honey.
content_old: 15 look from Thy holy habitation, from the heavens, and bless Thy people Israel, and the ground which Thou hast given to us, as Thou hast sworn to our fathers—a land flowing with milk and honey.

content: 16 ‘This day Jehovah thy God is commanding thee to do these statutes and judgments; and thou hast hearkened and done them with all thy heart, and with all thy soul,
content_old: 16 ‘This day Jehovah thy God is commanding thee to do these statutes and judgments; and thou hast hearkened and done them with all thy heart, and with all thy soul,

content: 17 Jehovah thou hast caused to promise to-day to become thy God, and to walk in His ways, and to keep His statutes, and His commands, and His judgments, and to hearken to His voice.
content_old: 17 Jehovah thou hast caused to promise to-day to become thy God, and to walk in His ways, and to keep His statutes, and His commands, and His judgments, and to hearken to His voice.

content: 18 ‘And Jehovah hath caused thee to promise to-day to become His people, a peculiar treasure, as He hath spoken to thee, and to keep all His commands;
content_old: 18 ‘And Jehovah hath caused thee to promise to-day to become His people, a peculiar treasure, as He hath spoken to thee, and to keep all His commands;

content: 1 ‘And Moses—the elders of Israel also—commandeth the people, saying, Keep all the command which I am commanding you to-day;
content_old: 1 ‘And Moses—the elders of Israel also—commandeth the people, saying, Keep all the command which I am commanding you to-day;

content: 2 and it hath been, in the day that ye pass over the Jordan unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, that thou hast raised up for thee great stones, and plaistered them with plaister,
content_old: 2 and it hath been, in the day that ye pass over the Jordan unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, that thou hast raised up for thee great stones, and plaistered them with plaister,

content: 3 and written on them all the words of this law in thy passing over, so that thou goest in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee—a land flowing with milk and honey, as Jehovah, God of thy fathers, hath spoken to thee.
content_old: 3 and written on them all the words of this law in thy passing over, so that thou goest in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee—a land flowing with milk and honey, as Jehovah, God of thy fathers, hath spoken to thee.

content: 4 ‘And it hath been, in your passing over the Jordan, ye raise up these stones which I am commanding you to-day, in mount Ebal, and thou hast plaistered them with plaister,
content_old: 4 ‘And it hath been, in your passing over the Jordan, ye raise up these stones which I am commanding you to-day, in mount Ebal, and thou hast plaistered them with plaister,

content: 5 and built there an altar to Jehovah thy God, an altar of stones, thou dost not wave over them iron.
content_old: 5 and built there an altar to Jehovah thy God, an altar of stones, thou dost not wave over them iron.

content: 6 Of complete stones thou buildest the altar of Jehovah thy God, and hast caused to ascend on it burnt-offerings to Jehovah thy God,
content_old: 6 Of complete stones thou buildest the altar of Jehovah thy God, and hast caused to ascend on it burnt-offerings to Jehovah thy God,

content: 7 and sacrificed peace-offerings, and eaten there, and rejoiced before Jehovah thy God,
content_old: 7 and sacrificed peace-offerings, and eaten there, and rejoiced before Jehovah thy God,

content: 8 and written on the stones all the words of this law, well engraved.’
content_old: 8 and written on the stones all the words of this law, well engraved.’

content: 9 And Moses speaketh—the priests, the Levites, also—unto all Israel, saying, ‘Keep silent, and hear, O Israel, this day thou hast become a people to Jehovah thy God;
content_old: 9 And Moses speaketh—the priests, the Levites, also—unto all Israel, saying, ‘Keep silent, and hear, O Israel, this day thou hast become a people to Jehovah thy God;

content: 10 and thou hast hearkened to the voice of Jehovah thy God, and done His commands, and His statutes, which I am commanding thee to-day.’
content_old: 10 and thou hast hearkened to the voice of Jehovah thy God, and done His commands, and His statutes, which I am commanding thee to-day.’

content: 11 And Moses commandeth the people on that day, saying,
content_old: 11 And Moses commandeth the people on that day, saying,

content: 12 ‘These do stand, to bless the people, on mount Gerizzim, in your passing over the Jordan: Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Joseph, and Benjamin.
content_old: 12 ‘These do stand, to bless the people, on mount Gerizzim, in your passing over the Jordan: Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Joseph, and Benjamin.

content: 13 And these do stand, for the reviling, on mount Ebal: Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
content_old: 13 And these do stand, for the reviling, on mount Ebal: Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

content: 14 ‘And the Levites have answered and said unto every man of Israel—a loud voice:
content_old: 14 ‘And the Levites have answered and said unto every man of Israel—a loud voice:

content: 15 ‘Cursed is the man who maketh a graven and molten image, the abomination of Jehovah, work of the hands of an artificer, and hath put it in a secret place,—and all the people have answered and said, Amen.
content_old: 15 ‘Cursed is the man who maketh a graven and molten image, the abomination of Jehovah, work of the hands of an artificer, and hath put it in a secret place,—and all the people have answered and said, Amen.

content: 16 ‘Cursed is He who is making light of his father and his mother,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 16 ‘Cursed is He who is making light of his father and his mother,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 17 ‘Cursed is he who is removing his neighbour’s border,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 17 ‘Cursed is he who is removing his neighbour’s border,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 18 ‘Cursed is he who is causing the blind to err in the way,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 18 ‘Cursed is he who is causing the blind to err in the way,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 19 ‘Cursed is he who is turning aside the judgment of fatherless, sojourner, and widow,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 19 ‘Cursed is he who is turning aside the judgment of fatherless, sojourner, and widow,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 20 ‘Cursed is he who is lying with his father’s wife, for he hath uncovered his father’s skirt,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 20 ‘Cursed is he who is lying with his father’s wife, for he hath uncovered his father’s skirt,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 21 ‘Cursed is he who is lying with any beast,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 21 ‘Cursed is he who is lying with any beast,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 22 ‘Cursed is he who is lying with his sister, daughter of his father, or daughter of his mother,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 22 ‘Cursed is he who is lying with his sister, daughter of his father, or daughter of his mother,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 23 ‘Cursed is he who is lying with his mother-in-law,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 23 ‘Cursed is he who is lying with his mother-in-law,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 24 ‘Cursed is he who is smiting his neighbour in secret,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 24 ‘Cursed is he who is smiting his neighbour in secret,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 25 ‘Cursed is he who is taking a bribe to smite a person, innocent blood,—and all the people have said, Amen.
content_old: 25 ‘Cursed is he who is taking a bribe to smite a person, innocent blood,—and all the people have said, Amen.

content: 1 ‘And it hath been, if thou dost hearken diligently to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all His commands which I am commanding thee to-day, that Jehovah thy God hath made thee uppermost above all the nations of the earth,
content_old: 1 ‘And it hath been, if thou dost hearken diligently to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all His commands which I am commanding thee to-day, that Jehovah thy God hath made thee uppermost above all the nations of the earth,

content: 2 and all these blessings have come upon thee, and overtaken thee, because thou dost hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God:
content_old: 2 and all these blessings have come upon thee, and overtaken thee, because thou dost hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God:

content: 3 ‘Blessed art thou in the city, and blessed art thou in the field.
content_old: 3 ‘Blessed art thou in the city, and blessed art thou in the field.

content: 4 ‘Blessed is the fruit of thy womb, and the fruit of thy ground, and the fruit of thy cattle, increase of thine oxen, and wealth of thy flock.
content_old: 4 ‘Blessed is the fruit of thy womb, and the fruit of thy ground, and the fruit of thy cattle, increase of thine oxen, and wealth of thy flock.

content: 5 ‘Blessed is thy basket and thy kneading-trough.
content_old: 5 ‘Blessed is thy basket and thy kneading-trough.

content: 6 ‘Blessed art thou in thy coming in, and blessed art thou in thy going out.
content_old: 6 ‘Blessed art thou in thy coming in, and blessed art thou in thy going out.

content: 7 ‘Jehovah giveth thine enemies, who are rising up against thee—smitten before thy face; in one way they come out unto thee, and in seven ways they flee before thee.
content_old: 7 ‘Jehovah giveth thine enemies, who are rising up against thee—smitten before thy face; in one way they come out unto thee, and in seven ways they flee before thee.

content: 8 ‘Jehovah commandeth with thee the blessing in thy storehouses, and in every putting forth of thy hand, and hath blessed thee in the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee.
content_old: 8 ‘Jehovah commandeth with thee the blessing in thy storehouses, and in every putting forth of thy hand, and hath blessed thee in the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee.

content: 9 ‘Jehovah doth establish thee to Himself for a holy people, as He hath sworn to thee, when thou keepest the commands of Jehovah thy God, and hast walked in His ways;
content_old: 9 ‘Jehovah doth establish thee to Himself for a holy people, as He hath sworn to thee, when thou keepest the commands of Jehovah thy God, and hast walked in His ways;

content: 10 and all the peoples of the land have seen that the name of Jehovah is called upon thee, and they have been afraid of thee.
content_old: 10 and all the peoples of the land have seen that the name of Jehovah is called upon thee, and they have been afraid of thee.

content: 11 ‘And Jehovah hath made thee abundant in good, in the fruit of the womb, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of thy ground, on the ground which Jehovah hath sworn to thy fathers to give to thee.
content_old: 11 ‘And Jehovah hath made thee abundant in good, in the fruit of the womb, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of thy ground, on the ground which Jehovah hath sworn to thy fathers to give to thee.

content: 12 ‘Jehovah doth open to thee his good treasure—the heavens—to give the rain of thy land in its season, and to bless all the work of thy hand, and thou hast lent to many nations, and thou—thou dost not borrow.
content_old: 12 ‘Jehovah doth open to thee his good treasure—the heavens—to give the rain of thy land in its season, and to bless all the work of thy hand, and thou hast lent to many nations, and thou—thou dost not borrow.

content: 13 ‘And Jehovah hath given thee for head, and not for tail; and thou hast been only above, and art not beneath, for thou dost hearken unto the commands of Jehovah thy God, which I am commanding thee to-day, to keep and to do,
content_old: 13 ‘And Jehovah hath given thee for head, and not for tail; and thou hast been only above, and art not beneath, for thou dost hearken unto the commands of Jehovah thy God, which I am commanding thee to-day, to keep and to do,

content: 14 and thou dost not turn aside from all the words which I am commanding you to-day—right or left—to go after other gods, to serve them.
content_old: 14 and thou dost not turn aside from all the words which I am commanding you to-day—right or left—to go after other gods, to serve them.

content: 15 ‘And it hath been, if thou dost not hearken unto the voice of Jehovah thy God to observe to do all His commands, and His statutes, which I am commanding thee to-day, that all these revilings have come upon thee, and overtaken thee:
content_old: 15 ‘And it hath been, if thou dost not hearken unto the voice of Jehovah thy God to observe to do all His commands, and His statutes, which I am commanding thee to-day, that all these revilings have come upon thee, and overtaken thee:

content: 16 ‘Cursed art thou in the city, and cursed art thou in the field.
content_old: 16 ‘Cursed art thou in the city, and cursed art thou in the field.

content: 17 ‘Cursed is thy basket and thy kneading-trough.
content_old: 17 ‘Cursed is thy basket and thy kneading-trough.

content: 18 ‘Cursed is the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy land, increase of thine oxen, and wealth of thy flock.
content_old: 18 ‘Cursed is the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy land, increase of thine oxen, and wealth of thy flock.

content: 19 ‘Cursed art thou in thy coming in, and cursed art thou in thy going out.
content_old: 19 ‘Cursed art thou in thy coming in, and cursed art thou in thy going out.

content: 20 ‘Jehovah doth send on thee the curse, the trouble, and the rebuke, in every putting forth of thy hand which thou dost, till thou art destroyed, and till thou perish hastily, because of the evil of thy doings by which thou hast forsaken Me.
content_old: 20 ‘Jehovah doth send on thee the curse, the trouble, and the rebuke, in every putting forth of thy hand which thou dost, till thou art destroyed, and till thou perish hastily, because of the evil of thy doings by which thou hast forsaken Me.

content: 21 ‘Jehovah doth cause to cleave to thee the pestilence, till He consume thee from off the ground whither thou art going in to possess it.
content_old: 21 ‘Jehovah doth cause to cleave to thee the pestilence, till He consume thee from off the ground whither thou art going in to possess it.

content: 22 ‘Jehovah doth smite thee with consumption, and with fever, and with inflammation, and with extreme burning, and with sword, and with blasting, and with mildew, and they have pursued thee till thou perish
content_old: 22 ‘Jehovah doth smite thee with consumption, and with fever, and with inflammation, and with extreme burning, and with sword, and with blasting, and with mildew, and they have pursued thee till thou perish

content: 23 ‘And thy heavens which are over thy head have been brass, and the earth which is under thee iron;
content_old: 23 ‘And thy heavens which are over thy head have been brass, and the earth which is under thee iron;

content: 24 Jehovah giveth the rain of thy land—dust and ashes; from the heavens it cometh down on thee till thou art destroyed.
content_old: 24 Jehovah giveth the rain of thy land—dust and ashes; from the heavens it cometh down on thee till thou art destroyed.

content: 25 ‘Jehovah giveth thee smitten before thine enemies; in one way thou goest out unto them, and in seven ways dost flee before them, and thou hast been for a trembling to all kingdoms of the earth;
content_old: 25 ‘Jehovah giveth thee smitten before thine enemies; in one way thou goest out unto them, and in seven ways dost flee before them, and thou hast been for a trembling to all kingdoms of the earth;

content: 26 and thy carcase hath been for food to every fowl of the heavens, and to the beast of the earth, and there is none causing trembling.
content_old: 26 and thy carcase hath been for food to every fowl of the heavens, and to the beast of the earth, and there is none causing trembling.

content: 27 ‘Jehovah doth smite thee with the ulcer of Egypt, and with emerods, and with scurvy, and with itch, of which thou art not able to be healed.
content_old: 27 ‘Jehovah doth smite thee with the ulcer of Egypt, and with emerods, and with scurvy, and with itch, of which thou art not able to be healed.

content: 28 ‘Jehovah doth smite thee with madness, and with blindness, and with astonishment of heart;
content_old: 28 ‘Jehovah doth smite thee with madness, and with blindness, and with astonishment of heart;
